identity.name: StaffFlow
identity.description: A precision-engineered scheduling tool for hotel management that balances high-density data with visual calm.

buttons.primary: bg-slate-900 text-white hover:bg-slate-800 rounded-md shadow-sm transition-all active:scale-95
buttons.secondary: bg-white text-slate-900 border border-slate-200 hover:bg-slate-50 rounded-md shadow-sm transition-all active:scale-95

inputs.base: bg-white border-slate-200 focus:ring-2 focus:ring-slate-900 focus:border-transparent rounded-md shadow-sm

cards.base: bg-white border border-slate-200 rounded-lg shadow-sm p-6

roster_cell.base: flex items-center justify-center w-full h-full transition-colors cursor-pointer hover:brightness-95

instructions_to_main_agent: Implement the roster grid using CSS Grid for performance and alignment.
Use the 'shifts' color palette strictly for the roster cells.
Ensure the sidebar is collapsible on mobile but fixed on desktop.
Use 'Manrope' for all headings and 'IBM Plex Sans' for UI text.
Use 'JetBrains Mono' for dates and time inputs.
The 'Generate' button should be the primary action in the top bar.
Implement 'Sonner' for toast notifications (e.g., 'Roster Generated', 'Staff Added').
Ensure the Excel export preserves the color coding defined in the palette.
Use the 'login_bg' image for a subtle texture or background if a landing page is created.
UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES_FOR_MAIN_AGENT: Do not use generic centered layouts.
Create depth through layered design elements.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable.
All interactive elements MUST include a data-testid attribute.
